alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 2:19PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED TUESDAY AFTERNOON... .Very dry and windy conditions will develop across parts of northeast Oklahoma Tuesday afternoon as a dry line moves into the area. The most dangerous conditions are expected to remain to the west of U.S. Highway 75, where several wildfires have occurred recently and may still be ongoing at that time. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 10 PM CDT TUESDAY FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS WEST OF HIGHWAY 75 IN NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 10 PM CDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, Pawnee, and Creek counties. * WIND...Southwest 20 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity 10 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE...Max temperatures mid to upper 80s. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
